title: "Life is good" hand drawn looking font
content: Does anybody know what font used for the "Life is good" line of clothing? Is it hand drawn?
author: drax911sc

comments.content: [Life Is Good](http://web.archive.org/web/20120110100618/http:/www.lifeisgood.com/) â€” a link for you.
Hand rendered I reckon. Both the lowercase o's and i's are different. Unless it's a type that's been tinkered with.
I'm pretty sure it's a font and I've seen it before but am drawing a blank right now.

I agree it's hand rendered. I posted this a few weeks back but with no great leads. I have to recreate this.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120110100618im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LIG_5413.jpg)

Consider [FF Providence Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20120110100618/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.7626.0.0) or something from this list of [hand lettered serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20120110100618/http:/typographi.com/000737.php).
recreate the Bob's your uncle part which i'm pretty sure is a font. Notice the lowercase "o". The incosistencies come in with the "r"in relation to the "n"

This topic has been discussed at our 'cousin' group of [WTF Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20120110100618/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=45805), over at MyFonts. They concluded that it was 'not a font' on the shirts (supposedly based on a statement from L.I.G. folks). However, I think the site that Conor linked shows that a similar styled font was generated to make the site captions.

I have no doubt it would be proprietary, since that is a big part of their brand 'look'.

- Mike Yanega
